meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel strong disgust or nausea.
meanings.sent1: The foul smell of the garbage was gipping me.
meanings.sent2: The rotten food in the fridge was gipping everyone in the house.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the slimy snail gipping the chef made the customers laugh.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie was so scary, it felt like it was gipping my soul.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the spoiled milk was so gipping, I couldn't swallow it.

meanings.definition: The act of retching or vomiting.
meanings.sent1: After the roller coaster ride, she experienced a sudden gipping.
meanings.sent2: The flu caused frequent gippings, making him weak.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gipping during the meeting embarrassed her.
meanings.sent4: The intense fear of heights gave him a gipping at the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the rotten eggs triggered a gipping reflex in her stomach.
